placeAddress: 1192 Queen St E, Toronto, Ontario M4M 1L4 Canada
reviewTitle: Food ok - but really really rude staff
reviewText: Our server - Jessica was great.  However, the pasta was undercooked.  They did accommodate us and re did the the pasta - but still not great.  However, what really ruined the evening was the incredibly rude staff member.  We were waiting for our bill for quite some time.  I asked other staff members to grab our waitress and ask for our bill - which they just basically ignored.  I said I would ask myself - and then the one staff member made really rude comments about me just loud enough so I could hear.  I had not been rude - we just had to leave.  It was totally not called for.  Will never go to this restaurant again and would not recommend.  When you are spending a lot of money for a night out - the staff should have the decency to be polite.

placeAddress: 1192 Queen St E, Toronto, Ontario M4M 1L4 Canada
reviewText:
Visited recently as a family of four. My wife had the gnocchi, which was lovely. I think I made a poor choice with the ravioli, which, although cooked well, didn't pack a lot lot of flavour.

Our visit was soured slightly by the pizza "chef" not being able to accommodate a fairly simple pizza request for the kids (essentially to add one topping to one half of the pizza). I found this rather odd, and I came away from the restaurant feeling disappointed with our experience.

placeAddress: 1192 Queen St E, Toronto, Ontario M4M 1L4 Canada
reviewText: We were 6 family members celebrating a birthday. It was our first time at Nodo Leslieville. Both the food and service were 5 star all the way. Lovely, friendly staff and delicious pastas. Loved the atmosphere. It does not feel too crowded or noisy. I believe that our server's name was Isabelle(?). She was terrific.

placeAddress: 1192 Queen St E, Toronto, Ontario M4M 1L4 Canada
reviewText: We had dinner here as 2 couples.  This is a small intimate Italian restaurant with great authentic food.  Wine list reasonably priced and regionally well represented. Cocktail offerings quite limited.  All dishes we had were very tasty and of good proportion . The only drawback , as noted by others was the loudness of the ambient music which interferes with normal conversation- cannot understand why it must be played so loud and unfortunately would lead us to reconsider returning

placeAddress: 1192 Queen St E, Toronto, Ontario M4M 1L4 Canada
reviewTitle: Wonderful Italian cuisine in Leslieville but my ears hurt.
reviewText: Timing of the food was perfect - kale and brussels slaw was fresh and crisply. The beef cheek was tender and the orecchiette pasta was also delicious. I‚Äôm not a huge fan of spicy food but this pasta dish had just enough chili for me. The only thumbs down to our evening was the loud music. This took away from the service and delight of our dining experience. I‚Äôm afraid the music catered more to the staff, hence the 3 star rating.

placeAddress: 1192 Queen St E, Toronto, Ontario M4M 1L4 Canada
reviewText: We love everything about this place! Great space with wonderful staff. The food is so yummy, and the menu is huge!

placeAddress: 87 Laird Dr, Toronto, Ontario M4G 3T7 Canada
reviewText: We had an event to celebrate, so we went local and had a blast.  Managed a seat in a quieter area and we went full out.  Tried many dishes (the "Tower" helped) and the staff were more than obliging to box the inevitable leftovers.  Thanks Heather!

placeAddress: 87 Laird Dr, Toronto, Ontario M4G 3T7 Canada
reviewTitle: It deserves a better customer rating!
reviewText: The ambiance was good, the customer service was great and the food was tasty. We will be back to enjoy some other items on the menu and some of the other beers.

placeAddress: 87 Laird Dr, Toronto, Ontario M4G 3T7 Canada
reviewText: After reading quite a few bad reviews for this restaurant, I was somewhat concerned when it was chosen as the location for a family reunion last weekend.  I needn‚Äôt have worried because nothing could have been further from the truth.  The food was very good; large portions and nicely presented.  Our waiter handled our party of ten with professionalism and friendliness.  There was a slight issue with one of the dishes and he dealt with it without fuss.  The restaurant itself is very large + there‚Äôs a huge wraparound patio.  I would recommend this restaurant.

placeAddress: 87 Laird Dr, Toronto, Ontario M4G 3T7 Canada
reviewText:
First time trying out Amsterdam Barrel House ‚Ä¶.Ambience is nice, great service and food is on point‚Ä¶.All kinds of beer and wine to choose from.
My only hiccup is the dessert selection‚Ä¶.jus 2 desserts and 3 ice cream choices for such an established place‚Ä¶.You all can do better

placeAddress: 87 Laird Dr, Toronto, Ontario M4G 3T7 Canada
reviewText:
The waiter was excellent. The restaurant was child friendly. 

The lunch menu was very limited and definitely not pub fare and even for Toronto was expensive.

The quality of the food was very poor.

Six (6) adults agree with this assessment.

Parking was difficult.

Very definitely would return.

placeAddress: 87 Laird Dr, Toronto, Ontario M4G 3T7 Canada
reviewText:
We dined there on Feb 11.  It was a family birthday and prevalentine get together for our group of 14.. We had a 6pm reservation and were seated promptly while the restaurant was very busy at that early hour.  Our server (one man) was Alex and he did a fabulous job.  He had a great staff to support him in looking after our birthday cup cakes and assisting with the delivery of our orders.  Service was slightly slow but it was totally understandable - I could not believe that almost every seat was taken.  We were served in reasonable time for our group size.  It was a full variety of good things ordered both food and drink.  We were looked after very well and many thoughtful assists with our needs and wants.  The food was very good and on the whole, the evening worked out very well.
We will certainly return and we have been there on a few occasions in the past and always found our experiences to be enjoyable.  In the summer, the patio is great.
Thanks to Alex and the management and staff.

placeAddress: 87 Laird Dr, Toronto, Ontario M4G 3T7 Canada
reviewText:
I was looking forward to meeting friends for the first time in ages (because of Covid), but the evening could have been better.

The patio of the Amsterdam Brew House is nice and the staff was friendly.  But overall there are more thumbs down than ups.  The worst part of the evening was a party on the upper level.  I was told that there was a reservation for 40 people, but more than 80 showed up.  For much of the evening people were screaming out the windows like lunatics.  This went on for a long while.  Eventually someone at a table near me had had enough and went upstairs and he was able to get the mob to shut up.  That‚Äôs really the responsibility of the manager and the staff, but they did absolutely nothing.

Other points were lost because of the food.  I ordered a chicken dish that was unbelievably bland and boring.  Imagine a chicken breast boiled in water for a few minutes, thrown on a plate and then covered in grated cabbage.  Not good.

Also, if you go on the Amsterdam‚Äôs official webpage there a special section for ‚ÄúSafety Protocols.‚Äù  A dozen different points are listed in terms of how the Amsterdam is making diners feel safe (even if Covid is on the downswing).  The Amsterdam really needs to update this page (or remove it) because I don‚Äôt think it was following a single one of its twelve points.

Finally, the Amsterdam has a real mouse problem.  They were running around all over the place outside (including on the seats).  I‚Äôve never seen that at a restaurant.

So a real let down, especially in terms of the screaming customers and the boring food.

placeAddress: 87 Laird Dr, Toronto, Ontario M4G 3T7 Canada
reviewText: The place itself  is pretty cool !! It‚Äôs nicely styled with patios at ground level and on the roof. The service was pleasant enough but the server probably had too many tables to look after.  What‚Äôs surely important in all restaurants should be the food! And this is where the last few restaurants we have visited have missed their point !! And Amsterdam fell into the same category  !! The beer is great but the food needs to be excellent !! Each dish missed the mark in some way ‚Ä¶.. interesting that none of the group said they would return. Owners and managers need to critic the offer and make sure it‚Äôs a good as possible - or at least that it meets their expectations. So ‚Ä¶.. go for the beer and patios ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ skip the food. (Or lower your expectations!! ü•¥)

placeAddress: 87 Laird Dr, Toronto, Ontario M4G 3T7 Canada
reviewTitle: As good as lunch can be.
reviewText: From the hostess that greets you, to the wait staff (Carol) to the hostess that says goodbye to you ... everyone was relaxed, friendly, and professional.      The "Blonde" beer was outstanding and the burger was superb.   Maybe I am just overly happy to be out and around semi-post pandemic, but I really enjoyed myself.

placeAddress: 87 Laird Dr, Toronto, Ontario M4G 3T7 Canada
reviewText: Food was good but Andrew was a lousy server that worsened our experience. He rarely checked on us. Never came to refill our water or check if we wanted more to drink. I had to ask him at the bar to get us another round after waiting too long and he gave attitude.  Seemed to give attitude to other tables as well. One of the lousier servers I have had in a looooong time.

placeAddress: 1192 Queen St E, Toronto, ON M4M 1L4, Canada
reviewText:
I‚Äôve been here before and had a decent experience, but my recent visit over the weekend was incredibly disappointing. The service was slow and really dropped the ball on this one. We waited over 20 minutes for a beer and glass of wine. When ordering, our waiter asked if we would like the appetizers to come out before our entrees, but everything arrived at once just minutes after our drinks. The meal felt rushed and poorly timed.
The food was okay, but for the price, the service didn‚Äôt measure up. There are better Italian restaurants in the area with similar pricing and much better service. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place and won‚Äôt be returning.

placeAddress: 1192 Queen St E, Toronto, ON M4M 1L4, Canada
reviewText: Hosted a private event here and was quite impressed with the food and atmosphere. Standouts were the cavolo salad, focaccia, and the braised beef shortrib. The bruschettone was quite bland and as such I don‚Äôt recommend it, but everything else was a hit. Would happily host again

placeAddress: 1192 Queen St E, Toronto, ON M4M 1L4, Canada
1192 Queen St E, Toronto, ON M4M 1L4, Canada
1192 Queen St E, Toronto, ON M4M 1L4, Canada
1192 Queen St E, Toronto, ON M4M 1L4, Canada
reviewText: Incredible food - I would say the pomodoro pasta (off menu) is right up there with the best in the city. A great way to judge an italian restaurant... otherwise service was great, and the food was 9/10. Our table of 4 agreed that there was no immediately obvious restaurant in Toronto that serves better Italian food than Nodo in Leslieville.

placeAddress: 1192 Queen St E, Toronto, ON M4M 1L4, Canada
reviewText: I had my wedding rehearsal dinner here with 30 guests and it was fantastic! We rented the upstairs and had food stations. The food was phenomenal - all my guests were raving about! The service was excellent and we had such a lovely evening. Would highly recommend Nodo for events.

placeAddress: 1192 Queen St E, Toronto, ON M4M 1L4, Canada
reviewText: Food was terrific, staff very helpful. Nice place, it was packed for a Tuesday! We shared some wine which increased the price per person.

placeAddress: 1192 Queen St E, Toronto, ON M4M 1L4, Canada
reviewText: Came in last minute after work/before a show at History. Sat at the bar and had wonderful service from Clayton and everyone else working tonight. We ordered a couple pastas and a pizza. The ravioli (ricotta in a butter and lemon sauce) was fantastic. Wine pairing suggestion was great as well.

placeAddress: 1192 Queen St E, Toronto, ON M4M 1L4, Canada
reviewText: Excellent for a a reasonable price. Nice decor inside and friendly staff.

placeAddress: 162 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 3N5, Canada
reviewText: The team at Salon were the best! From planning to execution, they did it all. Nailed it!

placeAddress: 162 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 3N5, Canada
162 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 3N5, Canada
reviewText:
I recently had the pleasure of attending an exclusive invite lunch at this hidden gem, and it truly exceeded all my expectations! The food was a delightful explosion of flavors, each dish crafted with care and creativity. The atmosphere is inviting and the charming ambiance adds a touch of elegance that makes every moment special.

If you're seeking a perfect venue for a private gathering, look no further‚Äîthis place is an absolute must-visit! Indulge in their exceptional dishes and prepare to be amazed.

placeAddress: 162 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 3N5, Canada
162 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 3N5, Canada
reviewText: It's Alo restaurant. The wait staff were so attentive and pleasant here. The venue is beautiful. A must.

placeAddress: 162 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 3N5, Canada
reviewText: Wonderful venue. Have been for both a wedding and birthday. Great food and top tier service.

placeAddress: 162 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 3N5, Canada
162 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 3N5, Canada
162 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 3N5, Canada
reviewText: Very VIP, great spot

placeAddress: 162 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 3N5, Canada
87 Laird Dr, Toronto, ON M4G 3T7, Canada
reviewText: I live in the neighbourhood and come here from time to time.  On my recent visit I ordered the pizza on the recommendation of the server.  I love pizza, and was looking forward to trying it when she told me it was one of her two favourite things on the menu.  If you like sweet sauce that has so much garlic in it that it‚Äôs just about the only flavour profile you can taste on the pizza this dish is for you.  It tasted like canned sauce with a bulb of crushed raw garlic added to it.  In addition, I‚Äôm not sure what was going on with our order but everyone that came in after us had their meals, and we still waited another twenty minutes.  Fortunately we weren‚Äôt in a hurry, but this simply should not happen.  I will go back to the Amsterdam Barrel House in future, but I will steer clear of the awful pizza.

placeAddress: 87 Laird Dr, Toronto, ON M4G 3T7, Canada
reviewText:
I've been comming here since the opening and usually the food is good. The chicken in the chicken sandwich was thin, dry and overdone in a small bun.
The brisket sandwich is good, but I remember it better and it's time to update the side beans.

placeAddress: 87 Laird Dr, Toronto, ON M4G 3T7, Canada
reviewText: Went here for an event, food and service was great! Thanks for hosting!!

placeAddress: 87 Laird Dr, Toronto, ON M4G 3T7, Canada
reviewText: We hosted a private event on the main floor. Matt, Erin, Catherine and the whole team were a pleasure to deal with. The food was delicious, the drinks were great, and the space was perfect for our guests. Overall an excellent experience. Thank you.

placeAddress: 87 Laird Dr, Toronto, ON M4G 3T7, Canada
reviewText: üî• üî• üî•

placeAddress: 87 Laird Dr, Toronto, ON M4G 3T7, Canada
reviewText: Was seated for 20 minutes and no one came to take our order

placeAddress: 87 Laird Dr, Toronto, ON M4G 3T7, Canada
reviewText: would give more stars if i could! best dining experience of my life. it IS a restaurant of that nature. thank you tabby!

placeAddress: 87 Laird Dr, Toronto, ON M4G 3T7, Canada
reviewText: Amazing mac n cheese and brisket! The portions are a bit big but great to share :) The service was also excellent, thank you so much Tabby!

placeAddress: 87 Laird Dr, Toronto, ON M4G 3T7, Canada
reviewText: Wings were a huge disappointment, lots of batter, you get six and the hot sauce is very dark and sweet. I was not a fan at all, this is the second time the food was less than par here. I won‚Äôt be back

placeAddress: 87 Laird Dr, Toronto, ON M4G 3T7, Canada
reviewText: Had brunch here and it was amazing! They also have DRAG BRUNCH? I‚Äôll be there for sure!!

placeAddress: 1660 Bayview Ave, Toronto, ON M4G 3C2, Canada
reviewText:
Unfortunately the food was the worst part about my visit at Fairway. I ordered chips and salsa and al pastor chicken. The chips were cold and stale, and the salsa was way too salty. Almost inedible. Al pastor chicken was okay but I didn't want to finish it.

Atmosphere felt a little weird. A bit too brightly lit for an evening visit. Went there for a Jay's game and it was not the best for viewing the game for everyone that was in our party. TV's where too small for the distance we were sitting.

The service was fantastic though!

placeAddress: 1660 Bayview Ave, Toronto, ON M4G 3C2, Canada
reviewText: Went for appetizer and beer. Good local selection and tasty app.

placeAddress: 1660 Bayview Ave, Toronto, ON M4G 3C2, Canada
reviewText:
I removed my review cause I did get a reply from the company. Even though I didn‚Äôt read it I removed the comment as I do not intend to affect the company or person involved in these hard times .

placeAddress: 1660 Bayview Ave, Toronto, ON M4G 3C2, Canada
reviewText: Had a great first experience! Andrew and Cindy gave great service and were really friendly. Tried the octopus carpaccio it was 10/10.

placeAddress: 1660 Bayview Ave, Toronto, ON M4G 3C2, Canada
reviewText: I had the opportunity to visit this place, and the environment is fantastic. The food is always fresh, the staff are friendly and fun, and the prices are very reasonable. You can also enjoy esports every day, which makes the experience even better. Highly recommended!

placeAddress: 1660 Bayview Ave, Toronto, ON M4G 3C2, Canada
reviewText: For a place this new they are making quite a good venue. Affordable beer, great bartenders, management is attentive. With time this place could be a great a great street staple

placeAddress: 1660 Bayview Ave, Toronto, ON M4G 3C2, Canada
reviewText: Great drinks and good options. Nice elevated experience for the block. Recommended.

placeAddress: 1660 Bayview Ave, Toronto, ON M4G 3C2, Canada
reviewText: Had a blast with my son at the simulator and great service :) Will be back!

placeAddress: 1660 Bayview Ave, Toronto, ON M4G 3C2, Canada
reviewText: Great cocktails, decent wine list - albeit very pricey - food hit and miss, service good, TV volume was battling the sound system volume resulting in a very confusing atmosphere. We were there at 7:pm on a Thursday evening and after all the food came we were told the ‚ÄúChef‚Äù wants to wrap-up so if we wanted more food we would need to order right away. What?? Very odd for early evening dinner service.

placeAddress: 1660 Bayview Ave, Toronto, ON M4G 3C2, Canada
reviewText: Easily the best food I've had at a sports bar. Great time, friendly staff, would recommend for anyone in the area!

placeAddress: 83 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5C 1S8, Canada
reviewText:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è An Exceptional Dining Experience at Convivium
From the moment I arrived, I was captivated by Convivium‚Äôs stunning decor and refined yet welcoming atmosphere. Every detail ‚Äî from the lighting to the service ‚Äî felt perfectly thought out.
I tried a variety of dishes, and each one was beautifully presented and full of flavour. You can truly taste the care and creativity that go into every plate. The team‚Äôs warmth and professionalism made the evening even more memorable.
Convivium is a rare gem in Toronto‚Äôs dining scene ‚Äî elegant, inviting, and consistently exceptional. I‚Äôm already looking forward to returning soon.

placeAddress: 83 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5C 1S8, Canada
reviewText: I love the food and service at Convivium, this is my 3rd time visiting and I'm planning to do a dinner here as well since they have party rooms in the 2nd floor. Service is next level, with amazing attention to detail, while food is extremely delicious with intriguing taste flavors.

placeAddress: 83 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5C 1S8, Canada
reviewText: Lovely little place

placeAddress: 83 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5C 1S8, Canada
reviewText: Sommelier was extremely knowledgeable. Discovered a new wine

placeAddress: 83 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5C 1S8, Canada
83 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5C 1S8, Canada
reviewText: The Tomahawk and Pavlova is outstanding same as a service and atmosphere . üî•

placeAddress: 83 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5C 1S8, Canada
reviewText: We booked a private dinner on the second floor last Friday, and it was definitely a bang for our buck. Our guests left impressed and full! Highly recommend ÔøΩ

placeAddress: 83 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5C 1S8, Canada
reviewText:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
An exceptional culinary experience in the heart of Toronto. Convivium Dining Community offers a super elegant and tranquil atmosphere, ideal for enjoying an evening for a special occasion. The decor is impeccable: every detail is carefully considered to create a welcoming and sophisticated ambiance.

The service was simply magnificent: attentive, friendly, and professional from the very first moment. It's clear the team is committed to providing a memorable experience.
Without a doubt, a place I will return to and highly recommend to anyone seeking quality, style, and warmth in a single restaurant.

placeAddress: 83 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5C 1S8, Canada
reviewText: We had an incredible experience at Convivium! We worked with Sergio to book a private dining room for our work social. Every detail was taken into account, the onsite staff were very attentive and kind, the food was absolutely delicious, and the bartenders were very knowledgeable and talented! Sergio even worked with us to create the perfect set menu that fit our budget and needs. 10/10, highly recommend!

placeAddress: 83 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5C 1S8, Canada
reviewText: Beautiful warm atmosphere in the heart of downtown Toronto.  Try the lunch special, high quality service and food for very reasonable prices.  Excellent wine options and great for small groups or lunch meetings.  Would highly recommend üëçüëç

placeAddress: 81 Bay St. 4th Floor, Toronto, ON M5J 0E7, Canada
reviewText: We just had THE BEST time with Chef David Salt. David was beyond professional, organized and it was just such a fun night! David came to cook for us at our house and provided a 5 Star experience from the moment he arrived! He was flexible, explained everything as he cooked and prepared, answered our many questions and just created a night to remember with unforgettable food! When planning the evening, David was incredibly responsive and accommodating to dietary needs! I can not speak higher of our experience with David and can't wait to continue following him through his culinary journey! Thank you David and we will see you soon!

placeAddress: 81 Bay St. 4th Floor, Toronto, ON M5J 0E7, Canada
reviewText: We just loved this Chef‚Äôs Table experience. The wine pairings were so unexpected and unique but perfectly matched to each plate. The knowledge and manner of both the chef and the sommelier made the night interesting, comfortable and a lot of fun. Our favourite dishes were the rabbit and the red snapper but the citrus dessert was gorgeous as well. The venue is warm and inviting, intimate but not intimidating. Can‚Äôt wait to visit again!

placeAddress: 81 Bay St. 4th Floor, Toronto, ON M5J 0E7, Canada
reviewText: Great food, great wine, great ambiance. And I especially loved the stories and explanations that accompany the many courses. Chef David Salt is a fantastic host.

placeAddress: 81 Bay St. 4th Floor, Toronto, ON M5J 0E7, Canada
reviewText:
This is hands down my favorite dining experience in Toronto. Amazing food, high quality ingredients, and every step of the way a thoughtful and personal touch. Be sure to get the wine pairing, too!

Updated: Drifter‚Äôs Solace has moved to Sips at 20 Maud. Can confirm it is still excellent!!

placeAddress: 81 Bay St. 4th Floor, Toronto, ON M5J 0E7, Canada
reviewText: David is an amazing addition to the food scene in Toronto. The dishes prepared by him are excellent.

placeAddress: 81 Bay St. 4th Floor, Toronto, ON M5J 0E7, Canada
reviewText: I've had the pleasure of eating Chef Salt's food a number of times throughout COVID, usually via take home, but also twice at the Chef's Table at Drifter's Solace. It is truly the pinnacle  of high end food in Toronto right now.

placeAddress: 81 Bay St. 4th Floor, Toronto, ON M5J 0E7, Canada
reviewText: Eclipses some of the best 3 Michelin star restaurants. Deeply educated sommelier staff coupled with a brilliant, creative chef make for an unparalleled experience

placeAddress: 81 Bay St. 4th Floor, Toronto, ON M5J 0E7, Canada
reviewText: A real treat. Get the wine pairings.

placeAddress: 81 Bay St. 4th Floor, Toronto, ON M5J 0E7, Canada
reviewText: We had a charming, intimate dinner at Drifter's Solace last night.  The venue, among the wine stacks of Grand Cru Deli, hardly feels like a restaurant, with fewer than a dozen diners at a time.  It's as if you happened to know an incredibly accomplished chef who offered to serve you a seven course dinner in a wine shop after hours.  The service is friendly, casual but precise and attentive.  And over the next three hours, the seven courses of the testing menu arrive, delivered by Chef David Salt, who visits each table to offer his work.  Fabulous small dishes with the freshest ingredients, beautifully presented.  The fried chicken and matsutake mushroom dish was a discovery.  The truffle cavatelli, my favourite.  The foie gras, a show stopper; the cold turbot confit, a rare and precious dish. I won't spoil the rest. Overall, the menu was well balanced and ultimately very abundant without being too heavy.  The wine pairings we had were on the lighter side, with many white wines -- to my taste, well chosen to complement the extraordinary dinner.  Drifter's Solace is not for every day (and priced accordingly) and not the venue to see and be seen.  But I would be delighted to go again for another celebratory dinner because it is memorably excellent and welcoming.

placeAddress: 81 Bay St. 4th Floor, Toronto, ON M5J 0E7, Canada
reviewText:
Wow! I surprised my wife on her 40th with a private dinner for her 6 closest friends and Drifter‚Äôs Solace went above and beyond. Dave put together the perfect meal, and I was able to combine his Sommelier‚Äôs wine pairings with some of my own bottles (very appropriate corkage fee). We had the whole space to ourselves for the night, Dave‚Äôs overview and breakdown of each dish (he even gave away some secrets) and we were served and waited over in luxury by a sommelier who will explain every wine and pairing to you.

It was the perfect setting for such this special milestone. Will have to find another reason to visit!

placeAddress: 501 College St, Toronto, ON M5S 2K2, Canada
reviewText: Josie is amazing. Good restaurant :-)

placeAddress: 501 College St, Toronto, ON M5S 2K2, Canada
reviewText: We had such an amazing dining experience! The avocado tartare stole the show for me ‚Äî perfectly tangy and so refreshing. Every dish felt innovative and so thoughtfully crafted. The silky spinach with burrata was such a creative, flavour-packed surprise. And the tiramisu? Truly chef‚Äôs kiss

placeAddress: 501 College St, Toronto, ON M5S 2K2, Canada
reviewText: Unique dishes with immaculate taste and flavour from around the world. They explained the thought behind every dish and presentation was amazing!

placeAddress: 501 College St, Toronto, ON M5S 2K2, Canada
501 College St, Toronto, ON M5S 2K2, Canada
reviewText: If you love seafood, you have to eat here!

placeAddress: 501 College St, Toronto, ON M5S 2K2, Canada
reviewText: Took my partner out for a date night, and we both loved the place.

placeAddress: 501 College St, Toronto, ON M5S 2K2, Canada
reviewText: Wow! What a beautiful and delicious space!! It has the global flavors like none other yet keeping everything so seamlessly authentic! It‚Äôs a one of the must eats that you can‚Äôt miss! And trust me I am quite tough to please! ( cause am a foodie with a diverse palette ) we had the tasting menu and ordered off the menu and every dish was perfection. All I needed was more people to finish it. Just go for it. Music and vibe is a bonus! Thank you ORO!

placeAddress: 501 College St, Toronto, ON M5S 2K2, Canada
reviewText: The food is delicious here

placeAddress: 501 College St, Toronto, ON M5S 2K2, Canada
reviewText: Wow the butter chicken here is better then most Indian restaurants I've been too

placeAddress: 501 College St, Toronto, ON M5S 2K2, Canada
reviewText: 2 thumbs up to oro

placeAddress: 623 Mt Pleasant Rd, Toronto, ON M4S 2M9, Canada
reviewText: I was thoroughly impressed with my experience today. The Caesar salad and frito misto were amongst the best I‚Äôve ever had. The pizza was perfectly cooked - slightly blistered, filled with high quality toppings and an authentic thin crust. The service was attentive yet laid back - perfect on a lazy Sunday afternoon. Will be back. üëç

placeAddress: 623 Mt Pleasant Rd, Toronto, ON M4S 2M9, Canada
reviewText: Amazing experience, staff on point. Attentive and patient. With multiple locations - food is excellent.

placeAddress: 623 Mt Pleasant Rd, Toronto, ON M4S 2M9, Canada
623 Mt Pleasant Rd, Toronto, ON M4S 2M9, Canada
623 Mt Pleasant Rd, Toronto, ON M4S 2M9, Canada
623 Mt Pleasant Rd, Toronto, ON M4S 2M9, Canada
reviewText: Went with friends for my birthday and everything went well from the food to the service and the atmosphere. Hope to go back again

placeAddress: 623 Mt Pleasant Rd, Toronto, ON M4S 2M9, Canada
reviewText:
My husband and I had lunch here today for the first time, together with our daughter and her partner.
Three of us ordered the three course lunch special and one of us ordered a pasta dish.
The food was exceptional and service was attentive.
Looking forward to dining here again.
Thank you Piano Piano for a lovely experience.

placeAddress: 623 Mt Pleasant Rd, Toronto, ON M4S 2M9, Canada
reviewText: On Tuesday, October 21 we celebrated my mother‚Äòs 87th birthday with 11 others and had the most spectacular dinner ever at The Mount Pleasant site. From the moment we walked in We were treated like royalty and all of us have been to some of the top restaurants in the city. The food, the ambience the people that served us made us all feel unbelievable the way they accommodated each person‚Äòs food, allergies, etc. unbelievable this will be our new home whether it‚Äôs for an event or just on a regular basis I cannot talk highly enough about everything unbelievable bravo thank you to everybody in the restaurant You guys all knocked it out of the ballpark. I highly recommend Piano Piano on Mount Pleasant to everyone outstanding five stars and maybe an extra couple.

placeAddress: 623 Mt Pleasant Rd, Toronto, ON M4S 2M9, Canada
623 Mt Pleasant Rd, Toronto, ON M4S 2M9, Canada
reviewText: Food was fine, but overpriced for what it is. You're paying for the vibe that comes with the cute exterior.

placeAddress: 214 King St W, Toronto, ON M5H 1K5, Canada
reviewText: Tonight we dined at Blu for my birthday.  Michael took excellent care of my wife and I and we had a lovely time. The service and the food were top notch! There was even live music that really made the experience that much memorable. Thank you,  we will be back!

placeAddress: 214 King St W, Toronto, ON M5H 1K5, Canada
214 King St W, Toronto, ON M5H 1K5, Canada
reviewText:
Went here with my husband for date night on a Sunday and we had the most amazing experience. We had the 5-course taster menu and every course was fresh, tasty and just right ‚úÖÔ∏è üòã.

The ambience is warm and classy. The live pianist added such a calm romantic feel to the night. Absolutely loved it. The service was so on point. The waiter was friendly, engaging, knowledgeable- he talked us through every course. Been a while since I met waiter who takes pride in what he does and does it so effortlessly, every guest around our seating area felt seen. 5stars to Michael.

placeAddress: 214 King St W, Toronto, ON M5H 1K5, Canada
214 King St W, Toronto, ON M5H 1K5, Canada
214 King St W, Toronto, ON M5H 1K5, Canada
214 King St W, Toronto, ON M5H 1K5, Canada
reviewText:
We celebrated our anniversary at Blu Ristorante at 214 King Street West, and what truly made the night unforgettable was our server, Michael. He is incredibly professional and attentive, and also one of the kindest and most genuine humans we have ever met in the fine dining world.

Fine dining with zero judgment and complete warmth is a dream. Michael made us feel so welcome and comfortable from the very first moment. I did not enjoy my initial dish and he handled it with such grace and positivity, happily helping me choose something I would truly enjoy. His warmth, patience, and bright energy were a breath of fresh air.

Because of him, the experience felt absolutely magical. The beautifully plated food, the lovely ambiance, and service that goes above and beyond. Everything was perfect.

We are definitely 1000% going back soon. Thank you, Michael, for making our special day even more special. üíô‚ú®

placeAddress: 214 King St W, Toronto, ON M5H 1K5, Canada
214 King St W, Toronto, ON M5H 1K5, Canada
reviewText:
We went to Blu Ristorante for the $57 pre-theatre menu, and the food was excellent.

Our server, Bryce, was fantastic ‚Äî friendly, attentive, and clearly doing his best despite the pace of service.

Overall, the food and prices were great.

placeAddress: 214 King St W, Toronto, ON M5H 1K5, Canada
reviewText: This was our 2nd dining experience at Blu.  The food during both experiences was wonderful and the service impeccable. My concern with today‚Äôs visit was the way they advertise their ‚ÄúPre Fixe‚Äù luncheon menu for $34.  Anytime I have had a ‚ÄúPre-Fixe‚Äù menu it is Appetizer, Main and Dessert.  In this case, it is only the Appetizer and Main.  Dessert is not included (but is on the ‚ÄúPre Fixe‚Äù menu card for an additional $6 each in teeney weeney print).  For 2 people it was an additional $20 which we thought was included in the $34 cost. Anyway, servers should make the client aware since this is not the usual way to offer a Pre-Fixe menu.

placeAddress: 159 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 1A2, Canada
reviewText:
I usually try the new capsules everytime I‚Äôm buying my usual, lis ( if im not mistaken) helped me and my boyfriend with trying new flavors based on our taste.
She was very nice and very patient.

placeAddress: 159 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 1A2, Canada
reviewText:
I have been visiting this Nespresso location for several years. I am a fan of Nespresso coffee and their products, and the quality of their espresso has always been consistent. The store is clean, well organized, and the products are displayed in a simple and uncluttered way.

My concern is with the customer service model. Purchasing coffee is entirely self service, including payment, and the sales associates usually remain behind the counter. During my most recent visit, I spent time browsing the machines because I am looking to upgrade. I was the only customer in the store, yet none of the associates approached me or offered assistance. They were engaged in conversation among themselves instead. It felt like a missed opportunity to highlight their products or answer questions.

I have also noticed that I am never greeted when I walk in. This makes me wonder why staff remain behind the counter instead of engaging with customers on the floor. If the experience is going to be fully self service, it raises the question of whether the store needs staff at all if the human touch is not part of the experience.

Overall, I still appreciate the brand and the product quality, but I hope this location improves its approach to customer engagement.

placeAddress: 159 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 1A2, Canada
reviewText: It was my first time visiting this Nespresso store to buy a coffee machine and capsules, and it couldn‚Äôt have been a better experience! The staff member greeted us so warmly and explained everything with such kindness. I asked lots of questions because I was new to Nespresso, but he patiently answered every one of them with a smile. Thanks to his friendly and thoughtful service, our first purchase felt truly special and happy. He even told us we‚Äôre always welcome to come back and try any coffee flavors we‚Äôre curious about, which made me trust the brand even more. I left the store with a big smile and a really good feeling! ‚òïüíõ

placeAddress: 159 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 1A2, Canada
reviewText: On my most recent trip to this location I was assisted by Aziz. He was knowledgeable, well spoken and provided more information than I have ever received on any trip to Nespresso. I was incredibly impressed and I assumed he was part of management by the way he conducted himself. I hope to see him as store manager one day soon since he has all the qualities one needs to possess required for that position!

placeAddress: 159 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 1A2, Canada
reviewText:
The service process at this store requires improvement. While waiting at the front of the line, an individual from the back bypassed the queue and was assisted immediately, despite others waiting. This resulted in additional delays for those who had followed the line properly.

When it was finally my turn, the associate attempted to process my checkout without allowing me to ask questions about products, even though the area is designated for customer assistance rather than self-checkout. Responses to my inquiries felt rushed, and overall, the level of support seemed inconsistent depending on the type of purchase being made.

I recommend implementing a clearer queue management system and ensuring associates provide consistent, attentive service to all customers during busy periods.

placeAddress: 159 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 1A2, Canada
reviewText:
I had a very disappointing experience with the customer service at this location. I got in line to order a few coffee pods, and while the employee behind the counter had just finished with the previous customer, she was intentionally acting busy, giving me side eyes instead of acknowledging me. There was no greeting, no "How can I help you?"‚Äînothing. She just stared at me until, after about a minute, I had to ask if she was ready to take my order. Unfortunately, her attitude remained unprofessional throughout the entire interaction.

It would be helpful if staff wore name tags so they could be easily identified. I understand that everyone has tough days, especially after dealing with difficult customers, but basic courtesy should always be a priority. Management should consider hiring staff who are at least as nice as the store itself.

placeAddress: 159 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 1A2, Canada
159 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 1A2, Canada
reviewText: My husband and I have been coming to this store for about 6 months and we always have a good experience. Unlike other stores this location doesn't have a specific person to make the coffee so the cashiers do everything, and even when they're busy they're always happy and friendly. They make great recommendations and there's always something new and fun to try!

placeAddress: 159 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 1A2, Canada
reviewText:
Worst Nespresso ever.

Today my friend and I came to this store to buy several sleeves of capsules, and the service was terrible. First of all, the queue signage was very unclear‚Äîwe couldn‚Äôt tell which line was for what. Despite the store being so large, there was only one cashier. After we queued behind another customer, we were rudely told to go line up somewhere else.

After purchasing, we wanted to try some new flavors at the bar area. We sat there for nearly ten minutes, and although the staff saw us, they completely ignored us. We had to approach an employee ourselves and explained twice what we wanted. After going back and forth without giving us a clear answer, she impatiently told us to join the cashier line because she was serving other customers. But there were no other customers at that moment, and there was no explanation why tasting required queuing at the cashier.

Overall, it was an extremely unpleasant experience. If the Yorkdale location had been open, we would never have come here.

placeAddress: 159 Cumberland St, Toronto, ON M5R 1A2, Canada
reviewText: the workers were very nice and the service was amazing the prices were really good

reviewText: Fantastic atmosphere. The food was delicious. However, be prepared to pay a substantial amount for your meals. I guess you are paying for the atmosphere. Nice for a date night or to make a good impression.

placeAddress: Casa Loma, 1 Austin Terrace, Toronto, ON M5R 1X8, Canada
reviewText:
I recently dined at Blue Blood Steakhouse, and overall it was a great experience. The atmosphere was absolutely beautiful, elegant, moody, and perfect for a fine dining night out. The octopus was cooked to perfection and full of flavor, and the beef tartare was fresh and delicious.

The only downside was the Wagyu steak, which wasn‚Äôt cooked quite to my standard. That said, the quality of the ingredients and presentation were still impressive. Despite that minor issue, I‚Äôd definitely return for the ambiance and appetizers alone.

placeAddress: Casa Loma, 1 Austin Terrace, Toronto, ON M5R 1X8, Canada
reviewText: Great experience, service and amazing steak

placeAddress: Casa Loma, 1 Austin Terrace, Toronto, ON M5R 1X8, Canada
reviewText: Absolutely fantastic! 7 of us for dinner before escape room. Came out to $300 a person. We started with a bottle of Prosecco. Multiple bottles of red wine. Finished off with a bottle of limoncello. Seafood tower. Steaks and sides.

placeAddress: Casa Loma, 1 Austin Terrace, Toronto, ON M5R 1X8, Canada
reviewText: Not what I was expecting üòï

placeAddress: Casa Loma, 1 Austin Terrace, Toronto, ON M5R 1X8, Canada
reviewText:
I brought my husband to BlueBlood for his 33rd birthday and, although I rarely leave reviews, felt compelled to write a lengthy review an entire week later due to our strange and unsettling experience.

Upon arriving for our 9:00 dinner reservation, we were told that our table wasn't ready because the party currently seated were "still finishing dessert". We were directed to the bar where we proceeded to order cocktails. I ordered the "Once Upon a Time" and the bartender paused before asking me if I like an old fashioned. I love them which is precisely why I ordered the drink, so I replied "yes". I considered that others may have ordered it simply because of the name without reading the description, but felt as though my drink choice was being questioned and can't help but wonder if my husband's taste preference would have been questioned had he ordered the same spirit-forward cocktail for himself. It took at least 20 minutes to get our drinks and and I believe we were finally seated at around 9:45 PM.

Upon being seated at our table, I had chosen the lobster bisque as my appetizer but before I had the chance to order my main course, the server interrupted me to provide an in-depth explanation of what lobster bisque is. I appreciate when servers take the time to provide a more detailed description of the menu items and how the chef prepares them but being that lobster bisque isn't an exotic dish by any means, it seemed as though he assumed I didn't know what I was ordering. I also speak French and certainly did not mispronounce "bisque" to give him that impression. I wanted to politely say "I am aware of what lobster bisque is, thank you", but couldn't get a word in and was too stunned to speak.

I adore fine dining and this is the first time in my life where I've had restaurant staff treat me as though I'm uneducated and incompetent... And this happened twice within the first hour of being there. A simple "yes, ma'am" without the preconceived commentary would have sufficed in both situations. Perhaps it was our age (we seemed to be quite a bit younger than other guests seated nearby) but I couldn't help but find the interactions to be rather insulting and condescending.

The ambiance was lovely and unique, the cocktails were fantastic (one of the best I've had), and the sea bass was delicious; However, the rest of the food was forgettable, the staff were unwelcoming, the service was slow, and we felt neglected as our server rarely came by our table. After setting down our main courses, the server immediately walked away before I had a chance to request a glass of wine. My husband was fortunate in that he had already requested that a glass of wine be brought alongside his main course when he ordered. I don't eat red meat but my husband said the steak was nothing special, and the lobster bisque was terribly bland. The establishment is aesthetically beautiful and our food consisted of high-quality ingredients, but the flavour and service are severely lacking.

I have been fortunate enough to dine at several Michelin Star establishments and the service here is atrocious by comparison. We expect good service at a "refined dining experience" and wanted to love BlueBlood, but we would not return. Unfortunately, I feel as though I paid to eat inside a castle and nothing more, and I'm sad that my husband's birthday dinner was so disappointing. I sincerely regret not just paying to visit the museum portion of Casa Loma and going to The Keg Mansion for comparable food and better hospitality.

I hate to see hard-working people waste their money and businesses who take advantage of consumers by underdelivering on quality for what they charge are beyond offensive to me. I'll happily spend $20 on a fast food meal or $2,000 on a luxury dining experience if I feel the cost is justified; It's about matching your product to the price and this place is not it. (Tip: If you love an old fashioned AND great service, we recommend trying Canoe - their brown butter apple old fashioned is exceptional).

placeAddress: 83 Yonge Street, Toronto, ON, Canada, M5C 1S8
reviewText: Lovely evening with a group of colleagues from around the globe. This was an excellent discovery for us and we enjoyed the meal and service immensely! Thank you to the staff for a memorable evening.

placeAddress: 83 Yonge Street, Toronto, ON, Canada, M5C 1S8
reviewText:
My husband and I recently had the pleasure of experiencing a truly exceptional date night at Convivium Dining Community. From the moment we stepped inside, we were struck by the sophisticated atmosphere, with service standards that easily rival the best Michelin-starred restaurants we've encountered in Europe.
The kitchen here is outstanding, with each dish showcasing absolutely fresh, high-quality ingredients prepared with evident care and thought. We savored every bite. The restaurant's design is also remarkable, creating a space that feels both elegant and welcoming.
Our experience was made even more special by the wonderful service. We were particularly impressed by Oxana, the manager, who greeted us warmly and took the time for a personal tour, a lovely touch that made us feel truly valued as guests. The entire staff was incredibly attentive and friendly, and their wine pairing suggestions were spot on, enhancing our meal perfectly. The overall atmosphere was inviting and convivial, exactly what we hoped for on our date night.
Located in the heart of downtown Toronto, Convivium Dining Community is a fantastic choice for a special occasion or anyone seeking a top-tier dining experience. It's clear why they are so popular ‚Äì we highly recommend booking a table and look forward to returning ourselves. As very grateful guests, we wish Convivium Dining Community continued success!

placeAddress: 83 Yonge Street, Toronto, ON, Canada, M5C 1S8
reviewText: Had a dinner tonight with a friend here at Convivium. Very interesting European fusion cuisine with extreme attention to details. Brand new place with interesting design, good service and nice atmosphere.  Good to go for a date with your other half, celebrate birthday or a corporate event. 5/5, Bravo, guys
